instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No 20V
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here. It's a return actually. The first time this board came here it had been all poked by another technician and there were 2 CD3215B1 in place of C00. After a lot of work I made the board work again. It worked for 2 months and this week it came back again with no 20V on charger. All LDO voltages present and all LDO diode modes ok between all 4 chips, all reading close each other. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.27V indicating no communication with T2. Machine does not enter in DFU nor gets recognized on another computer.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No 20V
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?
Also check the AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (its small coils).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No 20V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> Stable @ 3.3V
All SL2R and AWAKE voltages present. Only coils I don't get any voltage around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> are L7821/22/20/19

T2 chip gets a little warm. Not hot, but little warm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No 20V
threads.message:
Then T2 should be able to enter DFU mode.
Unless it can't communicate with the host machine (AC2), through corresponding <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.
